body.p: What's left to say about the year 2022? I survived it, as did most of those near and dear to me. Despite coming close several times, the UK's current apology for a government did not entirely collapse. As this blog attests, I spent much of the year trying to avoid this by travelling, when not engaged by grandparental or gardening duties.

list.item: In January and February, I seem to have done a lot of running about between dentists and doctors. I also paid my Covid dues and stayed in bed for a few days. And tried my best to contribute something sensible to the CLS WG3 project on counting "verbs of inner life".
In March I went to Galway for three weeks, nervously clutching a prestigious CLS INFRA fellowship to test my brief (but very enjoyable) reincarnation as an itinerant scholar.

In May I went, as usual, to Tours to teach TEI "niveau 2", and then to La Vergne where I stayed most of the summer, with the exception of a brief side trip to Nottingham to enjoy a Belinda concert and collect Lilette.
In June Lilette returned to Bristol and I went to Lyon to teach at an ENS summer school: it was very hot and the journey home was somewhat stressful
In July I took another brief visit to Galway to wrap up my fellowship alas
In August I escaped to La Vergne again
In mid-September, I came back to the UK perforce, to attend (and address) the annual TEI conference, this year hosted by the University of Newcastle
At the end of October, we celebrated (a bit early) our golden wedding anniversary with an extraordinary family holiday in the Forest of Dean

In November I managed to fit in another week in La Vergne, three days teaching TEI niveau 1 in Tours, and a day long meeting in Paris, before joining Lilette for a three week break in Mauritius, not before time.

body.p: The minute details of where and when are all logged in my Google Location History, but I don't know how to share that, other than by the occasional screen shot. But there are links to more detailed reportage of various kinds in the above list.
